SENT.plain: Intramuscular dexamethasone combined with intravenous low-molecular-weight dextran (dextran 40) was compared with placebo in 40 patients with acute ischaemic cerebral infarction
Dexamethasone was given for up to 14 days and dextran 40 for up to three days after the infarction
A weighted scoring system was used to evaluate neurological state and mobility
There were no differences in mortality or in improvement of the neurological or mobility scores between the two groups
